lead_paragraph: Outfielder Elijah Dukes missed the Washington Nationals’ final Florida exhibition game because he had to deal with some matters unrelated to baseball that the team did not specify. Dukes, who had sat out recent games because of a hamstring injury, was to travel to Washington separately from the team later Thursday. The Nationals said that Dukes’s obligations existed before the team acquired him from Tampa Bay in the off-season for a minor league pitcher. He had various arrests and suspensions during his time with the Rays.
